node.title: 'We had confidence': Mum of Perth man stranded with family in SA outback tells of fear turning to relief
node.description: The parents of a Perth man stranded with his wife and children in South Australia's remote outback have expressed deep relief after finding out their family is safe — but the travelling group is still facing a potentially lengthy wait for floodwaters to drain away.
node.content:
["The parents of a Perth man\u00a0stranded with his wife and children in South Australia's remote outback have spoken of their fear turning to relief after finding out their family is\u00a0safe.", "Perth couple Ori and Lindsey Zavros, and their two young children,\u00a0became stuck in\u00a0the Simpson Desert when their customised campervan was\u00a0bogged after heavy rain.", "They activated\u00a0an emergency EPIRB device on Friday morning, triggering a rescue response.", "The family is safe and well, police said yesterday, but is facing a potentially lengthy wait to become unstuck because the local track and the surrounding country\u00a0remain partially submerged by floodwaters.", "The Australian Maritime Safety Authority (AMSA) is\u00a0working with police on a plan to rescue them and has\u00a0dropped essential supplies including water and a satellite phone.", "A second supply drop is being conducted today, AMSA said.", "\"Coordination of the rescue is with SA Police who are maintaining ongoing contact with the stranded vehicle, and are assessing rescue options for a ground response,\" a spokeswoman said.", "\"Due to the road conditions and remote area this is proving difficult and SA Police have now requested a supply drop to the family.", "\"The AMSA Response Centre has contacted the family to confirm food supplies that are needed.\"", "", "
The four-wheel drive is bogged and surrounded by flooded roads.(Australian Maritime Safety Authority)
", "Ori's mother Theo yesterday described her initial fear, saying\u00a0it was\u00a0\"hectic\" and \"horrible\u00a0not knowing really what was wrong\".", "\"It was awful, it was absolutely awful. My mind was going through illness, accident,\" she told Channel Nine.", "But after hearing her son's voice say, \"please\u00a0don't worry, we're all okay,\" she was reassured.", "\"Really we had confidence he was very well equipped,\" she said.", "\"To hear that they were just bogged ... we were a little bit happier, that's for sure.\"", "", "
Water and a satellite phone were dropped from a plane to the stranded travellers.
", "Ori's father Lagis said it was \"just the unknown\" that was the initial cause of anxiety.", "\"We didn't know what state they were going to find things in,\" he told Channel Seven.", "\"The ground looked solid, and you go over it and all of a sudden it's like quicksand.\"", "Mt Dare Hotel owner Graham Scott, who is about 80 kilometres from the family's location near Alka Seltzer Bore but is cut-off from them by floodwaters, said it would take at least one\u00a0week \u2014 and potentially several more \u2014 for the road to become passable.", "\"That particular area where they are is just a renowned area for bogging. It's kilometres of just mudflats. When it's dry it's fine but when it's wet it just becomes impossible to navigate.", "\"There's only one track out there \u2026 [and] it'd be at least a week before you'd be able to get onto roads\u00a0with any confidence.", "\"They'll be fine, as long as they've got food and water \u2026\u00a0I gather they're not on a fixed time schedule so my advice is to find as many good board games as you can and just sit there and wait until it dries out.\"", "", "
The family of four became bogged after heavy rain in the area.(Australian Maritime Safety Authority)
", "Mr Scott said there was an airstrip within about \"a kilometre and a half\" of the family \"that is not quite an all-weather strip\", but\u00a0he was unsure whether authorities would opt for\u00a0an aerial rescue, or whether the family would want to leave\u00a0the campervan behind.", "\"If they do need to be pulled out, they'll need to be pulled out by some sort of vehicle and we've got a big four-wheel drive ex-Army truck we use for extractions out of the desert,\" he said.", "\"[Authorities] may call us, I don't know.\""]
